description: Triangular array T given by rows: T(n,k) = number of partitions of n into distinct parts, none of which is k (1<=k<=n).
example: T(7,4)=3 because among the 5 partitions of 7 into distinct parts, only [7],[6,1] and [5,2] do not contain the part 4.Triangle starts:0;1,0;1,1,1;1,2,1,1;2,2,2,2,2;2,2,3,3,3,3;3,3,4,3,4,4,4;
maple: g:=product(1+x^i,i=1..30)*sum(t^j/(1+x^j),j=1..50): gser:=simplify(series(g,x=0,18)): for n from 1 to 16 do P[n]:=sort(coeff(gser,x^n)) od: for n from 1 to 14 do seq(coeff(P[n],t^k),k=1..n) od; # yields sequence in triangular form - _Emeric Deutsch_, Apr 15 2006
author: _Clark Kimberling_
